key_components: Type definitions for theme colors, styles, and elements
5 predefined themes (default, high-contrast, protanopia, deuteranopia, tritanopia)
Utility functions for theme retrieval and merging

patterns_discovered.architecture: Centralized theme configuration with type safety
patterns_discovered.accessibility: Multiple colorblind-friendly themes using scientifically-appropriate substitutions
patterns_discovered.extensibility: Theme override system allowing user customization
patterns_discovered.backward_compatibility: Default theme matches existing hardcoded colors
patterns_discovered.code_organization: Clear separation of concerns: UI elements, agents, and message colors

gotchas_discovered.complexity: Extensive type definitions may require careful maintenance
gotchas_discovered.color_consistency: Need to ensure color substitutions in colorblind themes maintain visual hierarchy
gotchas_discovered.testing: Multiple themes require thorough testing to ensure readability
gotchas_discovered.performance: Theme lookup and merging functions should be optimized for frequent calls

approach_outcome.completeness: Full implementation including all required elements
approach_outcome.quality: High-quality, well-documented type definitions with accessibility considerations
approach_outcome.technical_excellence: Comprehensive theme system supporting both predefined and custom themes

recommendations: Add automated testing for color contrast ratios across all themes
Implement theme validation to ensure colors meet accessibility standards
Consider adding theme preview functionality in the configuration interface
Document theme customization options more clearly for end users
Add runtime theme switching capability for better user experience
